content: File an ADA complaint | San Francisco Skip to main content English Español 中文 Filipino How long it takes We will respond to your complaint within 30 business days. What to do Tell us what happened We will need to know: Your name Your address Your phone number The location of the incident Date and time of the incident Description of what happened How to file your complaint You should file a complaint in writing. If you have a disability, you can file a complaint by phone, or in other format that works for you. Fill out as much of the online form as you can. Provide your contact information so we can follow up with you. File a complaint online - English Spanish Chinese Filipino What's next After we receive your complaint, we will provide the appropriate department a copy of your complaint. An ADA Coordinator will then conduct an investigation. You will get a written response from us within 30 days after you filed your complaint. Special cases Request reconsideration Request reconsideration You can request reconsideration if you are not satisfied with the resolution. The reconsideration process: 1. Send the request for reconsideration to us in writing, or in an alternative format, if you have a disability. 2. Make sure you do this within 10 business days from the day the City issues a response to your complaint. 3. We will inform the departmental ADA Coordinator of your reconsideration request. 4. The Coordinator will respond to your request within 15 business days of receiving the request. 5. We must approve that response before we send it back to you. Complaint about employment Complaint about employment If your complaint is about discrimination against job applicants or employees, contact the Department of Human Resources.
